sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using iterative methods
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations using Jacobi iterative method:

3x + 2y + z = 9

x + 5y + 2z = −3

2x + 3y + 8z = −17

Starting from initial values x<sub>0</sub>=y<sub>0</sub>=z<sub>0</sub>=0 and perform iterations until the values of x, y, and z do not change by more than 0.001 between successive iterations.
message_2:
To solve the given system of linear equations using the Jacobi iterative method, we first rewrite the equations in the form x = f(x, y, z), y = g(x, y, z), and z = h(x, y, z):

x = (9 - 2y - z) / 3
y = (-3 - x - 2z) / 5
z = (-17 - 2x - 3y) / 8

Now, we will perform iterations using the initial values x₀ = y₀ = z₀ = 0 and continue until the values of x, y, and z do not change by more than 0.001 between successive iterations.

Iteration 1:
x₁ = (9 - 2(0) - 0) / 3 = 3
y₁ = (-3 - 0 - 2(0)) / 5 = -0.6
z₁ = (-17 - 2(0) - 3(0)) / 8 = -2.125

Iteration 2:
x₂ = (9 - 2(-0.6) - (-2.125)) / 3 = 2.475
y₂ = (-3 - 3 - 2(-2.125)) / 5 = 0.05
z₂ = (-17 - 2(2.475) - 3(0.05)) / 8 = -1.99375

Iteration 3:
x₃ = (9 - 2(0.05) - (-1.99375)) / 3 = 2.64791667
y₃ = (-3 - 2.64791667 - 2(-1.99375)) / 5 = 0.19895833
z₃ = (-17 - 2(2.64791667) - 3(0.19895833)) / 8 = -2.00260417

Iteration 4:
x₄ = (9 - 2(0.19895833) - (-2.00260417)) / 3 = 2.60130208
y₄ = (-3 - 2.60130208 - 2(-2.00260417)) / 5 = 0.19986042
z₄ = (-17 - 2(2.60130208) - 3(0.19986042)) / 8 = -2.00065104

We can see that the changes between iteration 3 and 4 are less than 0.001 for x, y, and z. Therefore, we can stop the iterations here.

The approximate solution to the system of linear equations using the Jacobi iterative method is:

x ≈ 2.601
y ≈ 0.200
z ≈ -2.001
